column2: Let me ask you, why is everybody using these tiny lights nowadays? I\nremember when people used to use big lights.'
That\xc2\x92s a good story, Grandpa.'
Hey'
Hey'
Wow, Monica\xc2\x92s letting other people help decorate her tree! Did\nsomeone get her drunk again or?'
Having a perfectly decorated tree is not what Christmas is about.\nIt\xc2\x92s about being with the people that you love.'
That is nice and we\xc2\x92re done. TADA!'
I dunno what it is, it just doesn\xc2\x92t quite feel like Christmas to\nme.'
Oh, here.'
See now it feels like Christmas!'

\xc2\x85 and that\xc2\x92s the story of the dreidle. Now, some people
trace the Christmas tree back to the Egyptians, who used to bring green palm branches into
their huts on the shortest day of the year, symbolising life\xc2\x92s triumph over death.
And that was like 4000 years ago.'
So, pretty much around the same time that you started telling this\nstory.'
Hey you guys.'
Hey Joe what\xc2\x92s up?'
I had to get out of the apartment. Janine is like stretching all over the\nplace. Y\xc2\x92know, everywhere I look she\xc2\x92s like\xc2\x85 (He imitates her stretching)'
I can see why that\xc2\x92s hard to resist.'
I like her so much!'
Aw, I\xc2\x92m sorry sweetie that she doesn\xc2\x92t feel the same way.'
I know. And she\xc2\x92s so sweet. I just wanna feed her grapes and brush\nher hair.'
You are aware that she\xc2\x92s not a monkey, right?'
I am so over Janine. I mean, yeah, at first I thought she was hot,\nbut now she\xc2\x92s like OLD NEWS!'
Hey guys!'
Hi Janine!'
I just got a call to be a dancer on a television special for New\nYear\xc2\x92s Eve. It\xc2\x92s called some sort of Dick\xc2\x92n Rock\xc2\x92n Dickie Eve.'
Hold it! Are you talking about Dick Clark\xc2\x92s New Year\xc2\x92s\nRocking Eve?'
Yeah, that\xc2\x92s what I said.'
Oh my God! We love that show! I mean Ross and I have been watching it\nsince I can remember!'
Ah, you\xc2\x92re still just a little fat girl inside aren\xc2\x92t you?\n(He kisses her on the cheek)'
Well I\xc2\x92m gonna be on it this year. I\xc2\x92m gonna be one of the\nparty people.'
You\xc2\x92re gonna be a party person! Those guys rock the most!'
Well they said I should bring someone. (To Joey) Do you wanna be my\ndance partner?'
Totally! I would love to spend New Year\xc2\x92s with you.'
Well actually they\xc2\x92re taping tomorrow. I don\xc2\x92t really\nunderstand why.'
Oh, well you see how it works is, the part with Dick Clark in Times\nSquare is actually live, but they tape some of the party stuff ahead of time. Yeah, not a\nlot of people know that.'
Yeah well, do you guys wanna come too?'
Are you serious?'
We are there!'
What, what are you laughing at?'
Well, I used to date him, but you\xc2\x92re still going out with her!'
Thanks. (To Monica and Ross) Great so we can all go together! I gotta\nrun. Catch you later!'
Bye!'
Bye Janine!'
Did she just ask me out on a date?'
I don\xc2\x92t think so.'
What are you talking about? She just invited him to the biggest party of\nthe millennium!'
Yeah, but she also invited you and Ross. Yeah, honey, I\xc2\x92m sorry,\nbut I don\xc2\x92t think that was a romantic thing.'

Oh. Maybe. But hey I know how I can find out. We\xc2\x92re going to a New
Year\xc2\x92s Eve party, right? So at midnight, I can kiss her. And if she kisses me back,
great! Y\xc2\x92know? But if she says \xc2\x91Dude, what the hell are you doing?\xc2\x92 I can
say \xc2\x91It wasn\xc2\x92t me, it was New Years!\xc2\x92'
Well, that\xc2\x92s a lot better than Ross trying to kiss me in High\nSchool, and saying that he did it because he needed chapstick.'
It was a dry day.'
We are going to Dick Clark\xc2\x92s New Year\xc2\x92s Rocking Eve!'
Oh my God!'
Oh my God!'
(To Rachel) Oh my God!'

OK, listen I\xc2\x92ve been on sets before, so let me give you a little\nadvice, alright? It\xc2\x92s a show, but we\xc2\x92re just dancing, OK? It\xc2\x92s no big deal.\nThe important thing to remember \xc2\x96 stay cool.'
Got it!'
Oh my God it\xc2\x92s just like I dreamed it!'
OK, everyone gather up.'
\xc2\x91Scuse us'
Here\xc2\x92s what\xc2\x92s gonna happen. The music\xc2\x92s gonna start,\nyou\xc2\x92re gonna dance, we\xc2\x92re gonna tape, you don\xc2\x92t look at the camera. Any\nquestions?'
Yeah, I have a question. When is this gonna air?'
Uh, yeah. Now you guys dance over there, you guys over there, and I\nwant you two right around here, and everyone else spread out.'
Ross! So when is it gonna air?'
Okay, you look in the kitchen, I will look in the back closet.'
I can save you time ladies, I\xc2\x92m right here.'
Yeah, Chandler why don\xc2\x92t you take a walk? This doesn\xc2\x92t concern\nyou.'
We are looking for our Christmas presents from Monica.'
What? That\xc2\x92s terrible!'
No-no, we do it every year!'
Oh well, that makes it not terrible.'
No, yeah, we never find them! She\xc2\x92s always best at us that wily\nminx.'
Don\xc2\x92t worry, we\xc2\x92re just gonna search here for an hour, them\nwe\xc2\x92re gonna go over to Joey\xc2\x92s and search, OK?'
No not okay, you can\xc2\x92t look for Monica\xc2\x92s presents!'
But we have to!'
No, you don\xc2\x92t have to, and you can\xc2\x92t because I live here\ntoo.'
Well then, you should look with us.'
Why?'
Chandler, aren\xc2\x92t you worried about what to get Monica for\nChristmas?'
No, I have a great idea for a present for her.'
Oh, that\xc2\x92s it? (Mimics Chandler) A great idea!'

Chandler, that\xc2\x92s not enough. I mean what if she gets you a great
present, two medium presents, and a bunch of little presents? And you\xc2\x92ve just gotten
her one great present? I mean that\xc2\x92s just gonna make her feel bad. Why would you do
that to her Chandler? Why? Why?'
If I help, we can find \xc2\x91em faster!'
That\xc2\x92s right!'
Ooh ooh, we have a live one!'
Oh, it\xc2\x92s a Macy\xc2\x92s bag!'
Ooh, who\xc2\x92s it for?'
(Reading) Dear losers, do you really think I\xc2\x92d hide\npresents under the couch? P.S. Chandler, I knew they\xc2\x92d break you.'
Uh-oh. She may be onto us.'
We are so gonna find them this year.'
Y\xc2\x92know when you guys said you were gonna go across the hall and\nlook, you don\xc2\x92t, you don\xc2\x92t do that every year do you?'
Yeah.'
You don\xc2\x92t, like go into the back of my closet, and look under my\ngym bag or anything?'
No, we never do that'

Because that\xc2\x92s where Joey gave me some stuff to store that\nI\xc2\x92ve never seen before in my life! Okay, that did not just happen! (He does a weird\nclicky motion with his fingers, that kinda hard to describe.)'
Okay, here comes another camera.'
Right. No biggie. Stay loose.'
Why do they keep doing that?'
If we wanna get on camera, I think we have to get up on one of those\nplatforms. They\xc2\x92ve been taping those people up there all day.'
Right.'
Hey, what\xc2\x92d you guys do to get up on there?'
We learned how to dance.'
Oh yeah? Well when you learned how to dance did you forget how to put on\nunderpants?'
Yeah!'
Hey! You\xc2\x92re a good dancer!'
Really?'
Yeah, well you\xc2\x92d be better if you just loosened your hips a little.'
What do you mean?'
Like this.'
That\xc2\x92s it, feel the rhythm. That\xc2\x92s better.'
Uh-huh.'
(To Joey) Okay, you\xc2\x92re dancing with that girl over there.'
No-no-no-no-no we came together!'
I don\xc2\x92t see it. (To Janine) You are dancing with the tall guy\nover there. Tall guy, raise your hand! (He does. Janine goes over to him.)'
No-no hey buddy, please let me dance with that girl, I really like her and\nI think I have a shot.'
Really, y\xc2\x92think so? I don\xc2\x92t..'
I couldn't find anything at Joey--Hey-hey, oh hey!"
Yeah, we found them. There were in the guest room closet behind some\ncoats.'
Yeah, and you have nothing to worry about 'cos they're all crap!"
Those are my gifts, I got them for you.'
Ohhh. Thanks Chandler they're great!"
Well Chandler, what is this very weird, metal A Z thing?'
Those are book ends! That's a great gift!"
Oh, okay, I'm sorry, thank you for my azzz. "
Ha!'
Make sure you put all that stuff back in the closet, okay?'
Yes, okay, oh, by the way, I just gotta say, I think it's really nice of\nyou that even after you've moved, you still keep storing that stuff for Joey!"

Hey-hey dancer girl! Can I go to the bathroom? I just.. (The girl starts
dancing really close to him, so he picks her up, twirls her round, and puts her against a
platform) Here we go. (He walks away to find Monica and Ross doing a really out of place
dance) Looking good Gellers!'
We know!'
Hey, see that snippy guy over there? He\xc2\x92s the one who decides who\ngets up on the platform. We should go dance by him.'
Okay.'
Okay, everybody hold!'

Next on the platforms are\xc2\x85 (He points to the right of Ross and
Monica, so they dance over to where he\xc2\x92s pointing to. He points away from them)
\xc2\x85you two! And\xc2\x85 (He points the other way, and Ross and Monica follow his arm.
Again he points away.) \xc2\x85You two!'
Excuse me, sir, would it help if I weren\xc2\x92t wearing underpants?'
Monica! (Pause) Would it?'
Hey! Tall guy! Hey, listen, I wanted to talk to you about that girl that\nyou\xc2\x92re dancing with.'
She\xc2\x92s nice, huh? To think I almost brought my wife to\nthis!'
Yeah, yeah, okay. Uh, look buddy, I came with that girl, and I had this\nplan to kiss her at the new years countdown \xc2\x96 I\xc2\x92m trying to win her over, so I\nwas wondering if..'
No I don\xc2\x92t think so.'
Oh come on man, you can dance with my partner, she\xc2\x92s real, uh,\nmellow!'
Look, are you dating this girl you came with?'
Well, I was hoping after tonight that maybe I could you know\xc2\x85'
No, no. She\xc2\x92s fair game if you ask me, sorry buddy!'

Alright, alright, hey y\xc2\x92know fair is fair, (he pretends to wash his\nhands) if you\xc2\x92re right, you\xc2\x92re right, what can I say, but hey oh no! (He throws\nwater on the guy\xc2\x92s pants)'
God! What are you, in second grade?'
Hey, now you\xc2\x92re the one who wet his pants. (He throws another handful\non him and runs out)'
Man, this sucks! Y\xc2\x92know if Mom and Dad don\xc2\x92t see us on TV\nafter we made them so jealous, I mean, who\xc2\x92s gonna be the losers then?'
Hey, I know what\xc2\x92ll get us up on a platform!'
What?'
The routine!'
Ross, we haven\xc2\x92t done the routine since middle school.'
Hey, when the snippy guy sees the routine, he\xc2\x92ll wanna build\nus our own platform!'
Was it really that good?'
We got honourable mention in the brother/sister dance category!\nLook, it\xc2\x92s almost fake midnight, do we really have any other choice?'
Okay, let\xc2\x92s do it. Mom and Dad are gonna be so faced!'
So, do we really have to ask who\xc2\x92s going up on the platform\nnext?'
Oh no! You get up there and do that again exactly like that!'
Yes! (They run over to a platform)'

(To Cameraman) Make sure you get this, they\xc2\x92re gonna want it for\nthe bloopers show. (To everyone) Alright cut! Listen up everyone, when we start again\nit\xc2\x92s gonna be the countdown to new years, so I wanna see everybody\xc2\x92s excitement.'
Hey, pal, you have about three seconds to get away from my\npartner.'
What\xc2\x92s going on over here?'
Uh, take a look at the guy\xc2\x92s pants! I mean, I know you told us to\nshow excitement, but don\xc2\x92t you think he went a little overboard?'
What\xc2\x92s the matter with you? Get out of here!'
Yeah, take a hike wetpants!'
Can you believe this? We\xc2\x92re gonna be on the platform for the\nMillennium moment!'
I know! Hey, you haven\xc2\x92t been practising the routine, have you?'
No!'
Me too!'
Hey, when the music starts up again, I was thinking of maybe goind\ninto the robot, y\xc2\x92know? (He mimics a robot)'
Ross, I think we should stick to the routine, we don\xc2\x92t wanna look\nstupid!'
Alright we\xc2\x92re back! Ten seconds left here we go! Ten! Nine!\nEight! Seven! (He continues to count as we hear Joey think)'
Okay, it all comes down to this. Whatever happens,\nhappens. Destiny.'
Three, Two, One!'
Cut!'
No! Year! Happy No Year!'
Okay, here\xc2\x92s where we go to the live shot of Times Square, nice\nwork everyone that\xc2\x92s a wrap!'
Hey! Look who I found!'
Oh, hey guys!'
Y\xc2\x92know, birds have a very good sense of direction, and I thought\nmaybe they could help us find where the presents are hidden.'
Yes, if the presents are hidden south for the winter.'
Or we could just follow your clever jokes \xc2\x96 any ideas? No!\nDidn\xc2\x92t think so! Okay, c\xc2\x92mon guys, show us where the presents are!'
Oh, the duck seems to think that Monica got me garbage! Hmm, I wonder\nwhat I could get Monica that\xc2\x92s as good as garbage?'
Hmm, how about my azzz?'
Hey, this is hollow.'
What?'
This bench, it\xc2\x92s hollow! I can\xc2\x92t believe I never knew that!\n(She pushes all the pillows off it and opens it up) Oh, the presents!!!'
No, don\xc2\x92t look directly at them!'
What?'
Alright, no, we could look at them!'
Oh, this one\xc2\x92s for me!'
Oh, this one\xc2\x92s for Chandler. Here.'
Oh great!'
And the big one\xc2\x92s for me!'
Ooh, let\xc2\x92s open them!'
Okay! Okay! Okay!'
Hee hee!'
Wait, we can\xc2\x92t do this.'
Why?'

I don\xc2\x92t wanna know what Monica got me. Y\xc2\x92know? I mean, look,
I\xc2\x92m sure she worked really hard at getting you a present, and wanting to surprise me,
and you guys are gonna ruin that, and I, look we have to put these back, this is not what
Christmas is about.'
Whatever Linus, I\xc2\x92m opening mine.'

Nobody is opening anything ok? Look, I don\xc2\x92t know about you guys,
but I wanna see the look on Monica\xc2\x92s face when I give her my present, and I\xc2\x92m
sure she wants to see the look on my face when I get mine. So please, please, can we just,
can we put them back?'
Will you get us better gifts?'
Fine!'
Hey guys! You found the presents? Chandler, you let them find the\npresents? Great! Do you know how long it took me to find you that water purifier?'
That\xc2\x92s what you got me?'
Oh yes, I see what you mean. That look is priceless.'

Home sweet home, huh? Nice to, uh, get back to reality. Plus we know how\nthe New Year\xc2\x92s gonna go off. I guess there\xc2\x92s no reason for all that Y2K panic,\ny\xc2\x92know? Anyway, g\xc2\x92night!'
Joey.'
Yeah?'
(She takes his hands) 3, 2, 1. (She kisses him) Happy New Year.'
Oh, yoii. What was that for?'
Well, I don\xc2\x92t know tonight when they yelled cut and we didn\xc2\x92t\nget to kiss, I was really, really, disappointed, and I just, really wanted to kiss you'
Really? In the moment, I really wanted to kiss you too. In the moment.'
In the moment, yeah.'
But only in the moment. So do ya wanna kiss again?'
Sure, New Year\xc2\x92s Eve is only two weeks away. Can you wait?'
No.'
Me neither.'
Joey, you don\xc2\x92t have to count down every time we kiss.'
Uh, yeah, okay. Except I sorta felt like I needed a couple of seconds to\nget ready.'
We were on the platform, ready to dance the world into the new\nMillennium, and the guy yelled \xc2\x91CUT!\xc2\x92'
Uh, wait, so you guys are telling me you actually did the routine from\neighth grade?'
Yeah. But of course we had to update it a little bit. (To Ross) Hey, by\nthe way, great thinking about catching me!'
\xc2\x91Cos I was gonna say there\xc2\x92s no way you could\xc2\x92ve done the\nend the way you guys did it back then!'
What? We could do it!'
I don\xc2\x92t know, I mean you were a lot bigger, I mean, stronger\nback then.'
I can do it, okay? Come on, let\xc2\x92s go. (She and Ross get up)'
1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8 (Ross runs to be caught by\nMonica, but she moves out of the way)'
I can\xc2\x92t do it! (Ross falls into Monica\xc2\x92s room)'
Now you do that, you\xc2\x92re on TV.'
